page.title: 06GUIDE DOG CENTRE,BOLTON
page.content: In our area there is a guide dog centre called Nuffield House on Lowndes Street Bolton.It was opened by Princes Alexandra.There are now six guide dog centres.The breeding centre where the guide dogs are born is in Warwickshire.At six weeks old they are sent to the guide dog centre in Bolton where they stay for the night and then given to puppy walkers until they are one year old and then they are given back to the centre to be trained as guide dogs.The dogs are trained initially in the grounds of the centre,then in streets around the centre and finally in the busy town centre.There are approximately 30 dogs in each block and there are four blocks.It takes eight months to train a dog and costs about Â£2000.When the dogs are ready the blind people come to stay at the centre.
